learning_outcomes.description: Explain and apply the fundamental principles of environmental management.
Comprehend the multidisciplinary nature of environmental management and how working in multidisciplinary teams facilitates solving practical environmental problems.
Critically evaluate and integrate differing scientific, political, economic, cultural, social and legal perspectives in addressing environmental issues.
Discuss differing social and cultural values and how they impact on environmental problem solving.

assessments.task_description:
A Field/Research Report -

Students may choose only one of the following topics for this report:

1. Windfarm development impacts.

2. Solar panels and long-term sustainability of solar panels.

3. Just how clean is green technology?

 4. Where does all the waste go? 

WORD LIMIT: 4000 words +/- 10%

Please see Blackboard for the full assessment description and criteria.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Quiz 1: Lectures 1 to 6

Students will need to answer all 20 multiple choice true/false questions in 20 minutes (0.5% per correct answer out of 10% - The student must answer the entire question in full to receive a 0.5% mark for all question) that will be made available on Blackboard. A 5-day window will be open to complete the 20-minute quiz online.

This quiz will cover lectures 1 to 6 and will consist of multiple choice, true/false questions taken directly from the lectures and reading set for students in both the lectures and contact sessions.

Quiz 2: Lectures 7 to 12

Students will need to answer all 20 multiple choice true/false questions in 20 minutes (0.5% per correct answer out of 10% - The student must answer the entire question in full to receive a 0.5% mark for all question) that will be made available on Blackboard. A 5-day window will be open to complete the 20-minute quiz online.

This quiz will cover lectures 7 to 12 and will consist of multiple choice, true/false questions taken directly from the lectures and reading set for students in both the lectures and contact sessions.

All quizzes are Open Book.

All quizzes open from 8am on Monday and close at 2pm on Friday. There is a 5-day window to take the 20-minute quiz.  Please make sure you answer all the questions. 

You are allowed only one attempt of the 20-minute quiz within the 5-day window, the highest grade you achieve will be recorded

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission via Blackboard only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission details.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Overview:

  • The exam consists of 12 short‑answer questions, each linked to a lecture topic.
  • You must answer any 3 questions of your choice.
  • Each question is worth 10% of the course grade (total = 30%).
  • Recommended length: 200–300 words per answer.
  • Write clearly and concisely. Support your answers with examples where appropriate.
  • Time allowed: 60 minutes – 20 minutes per question

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
